Execution of system shutdown/reboot comm.Data: Windows Event ID 1074; Windows Event ID 6006; Windows Event ID 4688
Execution of system shutdown/reboot comm.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 1074, 6006, and 4688 (process creation) for execution of system shutdown or reboot commands ('shutdown', 'restart', 'reboot', etc.). Investigate any unexpected, unauthorized, or scheduled events that occur at unusual times or originate from unexpected systems. Use time series analysis to identify anomalous spikes in the frequency or volume of these events across the environment or on critical systems.

Execution of remote command execution to.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 on servers and endpoints for process creations associated with remote command execution tools (e.g., 'ssh', 'plink', 'psexec', 'net rpc shutdown', 'wmic') where the target IP address or hostname corresponds to a network device. Identify execution attempts originating from unusual source systems, targeting critical network infrastructure, or occurring in conjunction with detected network instability or reloads.

Sudden, widespread network connection fa.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for sudden drops in active connections or cessation of traffic across multiple internal systems simultaneously. Correlate with Windows Event ID 5156 indicating failed network connections on hosts. Use time series analysis and anomaly detection on connection counts, session durations, or byte volumes per host/subnet to identify widespread, synchronized network disruptions. Compare current network traffic patterns (e.g., using descriptive statistics on byte counts in conn.log) to historical baselines to identify significant deviations indicative of system outages.

Remote login attempts or command executi.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4688; Zeek conn.log
Remote login attempts or command executi.Action: Correlate successful remote logons (Windows Event ID 4624 Type 3 for network logon) or connections to management ports (Zeek conn.log for 5985, 5986, 22, 3389) on a system with subsequent system shutdown/reboot events (Windows Event ID 1074, 6006) on the same system within a short time window (e.g., 1-5 minutes). Analyze command line details in related Windows Event ID 4688 events on the target system for shutdown/reboot commands. Flag instances where remote access immediately precedes a shutdown.
